definition: clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: I know their tricks and stratagems.
sentences.chinese: 我對他們的花招和戰略洞若觀火。
